title: 109_hr5952
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bodegas as Catalysts for Healthy Living Act" and includes grants for small businesses and consumer education and outreach. The "Bodegas as Catalysts for Healthy Living Act" authorizes grants for small businesses to expand their inventory to include fresh fruits and vegetables. The Act authorizes grants for small businesses to expand inventory to include fresh fruits, vegetables, and healthy alternatives. Community-based organizations are also provided assistance for consumer education and outreach activities promoting healthy living. Collaboration with these organizations is required for small businesses to receive assistance in expanding inventory. Community-based organizations can receive assistance in expanding inventory by collaborating with small businesses. Grants under this section are limited to $100,000, with an authorization of $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2007. SEC. 3. COVERAGE OF ADDITIONAL PRIMARY CARE AND PREVENTIVE SERVICES UNDER THE MEDICARE AND MEDICAID PROGRAMS. Amends Section 1861 of the Social Security Act to include additional primary and preventive services in the Medicare program. The term 'additional primary and preventive services' under the Medicare program includes services for obesity prevention and treatment, supervised exercise sessions, exercise stress testing, lifestyle modification education, and culinary arts education for proper nutrition promotion. Amendments are made to Section 1862(a)(1) of the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to the Medicare and Medicaid programs to include additional primary care and preventive services, such as obesity prevention, supervised exercise sessions, and lifestyle modification education. Amendments to the Medicare and Medicaid programs will include additional primary care and preventive services not covered under the current subsection. The effective date for these amendments will be the first day of the first calendar quarter after the enactment of the Act.
